intro: Cistus ledonius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its low-growing shrub form and evergreen foliage, with narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and coastal environments. Cistus ledonius is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
